Description: Ostracon, fragment (two pieces joined) of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is smeared with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a list of articles.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.124)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87636) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87636)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 146 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
